sentences.english: Your track is diverging from reference line.
sentences.chinese: 你船的航迹和参照线不平行。

sentences.english: The perfect very low penetration route can be developed by heuristic research method.
sentences.chinese: 并利用逐级搜索法决策出理想的飞机超低空突防航迹。

sentences.english: A contrail is the visible vapor trail behind airplanes or rockets traveling at high altitudes.
sentences.chinese: 这团痕迹可能是飞机或火箭飞上高空后留下的航迹云。

sentences.english: In chapter 5, distributed track-to-track fusion algorithms are discussed.
sentences.chinese: 第五章研究分布式航迹融合算法。

sentences.english: Track initialization is an important problem in multi-target track processing.
sentences.chinese: 航迹起始是多目标航迹处理中的重要问题。

sentences.english: Track initialization is an important problem in multi-target track processing.
sentences.chinese: 航迹起始是多目标航迹处理中的重要问题。

sentences.english: Then, the geometric relation between the mapped area and the flight path of the antenna is determined.
sentences.chinese: 分析了成像区位置与载机航迹的几何关系。

sentences.english: Alter course for next leg of track now.
sentences.chinese: 如今转向进进下一个航迹区内。

sentences.english: Route planning is an up-to-date technique for the very low altitude penetration.
sentences.chinese: 航迹规划是新一代的超低空突防技术。

sentences.english: Request permission to divert20 miles right of track to avoid the thunderstorm( build-ups).
sentences.chinese: 请求向航迹右面改20海里避开雷雨。

sentences.english: The track control strategies contain both direct approach and indirect approach.
sentences.chinese: 航迹控制可分为直接法与间接法两种。

sentences.english: We just saw the foaming white wake of the liner.
sentences.chinese: w我们只看到班轮驶过留下的白沫翻腾的航迹。

sentences.english: A boat wake cuts across one of the oil packets at image top right.
sentences.chinese: 在图像的右上角，一条船舶航迹径直穿过一片浮油带。

sentences.english: Your track is converging to reference line.
sentences.chinese: 你船的航迹正与参照线相交一点。

sentences.english: When the ship sailed, the foaming white wake of the liner was left.
sentences.chinese: 轮船驶过，留下了白沫翻腾的航迹。

definition: to form into columns/to organize into teams/formation (of ships or aircraft)
course/direction (a ship or plane is heading in)
to return to the point of departure
to fly across/to fly over/to fly past/(literary) (of one's spirits) to soar
to travel a great distance by sea or air/voyage/long-haul flight
